title: Quiz 3: Practical Exam - February 2020
description: Practical exam simulation focused on Salary Management Systems, Calculated Fields, and Queries.

questions.question: What is the name of the database to be created for this practical?
questions.explanation: Question 1: 'Create the database with the name KK Salary Management System'.

questions.question: Which fields are contained in 'Table I: Employee biodata'? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Table I contains Employee No, Employee Name, Gender, and Age. Gross Pay is in Table II.
questions.hint: Check the column headers for Table I.

questions.question: In step (c), you are required to register a formula to calculate the 'payee' at ___BLANK___% of the gross pay.
questions.explanation: Instruction (c): 'Register formula to calculate the payee at 30% of the gross pay'.
questions.hint: Look for the percentage value in instruction (c).

questions.question: What is the NSSF rate to be calculated based on the gross pay?
questions.explanation: Instruction (d): 'calculate it at 1% for each employee based on gross pay'.
questions.hint: It is a very small percentage mentioned in instruction (d).

questions.question: Which field serves as the Primary Key for both tables?
questions.explanation: Instruction (e): 'Set employee no. as the primary key'.
questions.hint: It is the unique number assigned to each staff member.

questions.question: Arrange the steps to Create a Form using the Form Wizard (Instruction h):

items.text: Include gross pay, payee and NSSF fields

questions.explanation: The instruction asks to include biodata fields AND payment fields (gross pay, payee, NSSF) in one form.
questions.hint: You need to select fields from both tables.

questions.question: For the query in instruction (g), what is the minimum salary threshold for employees to be included?
questions.explanation: Instruction (g): 'salaries of employees of more than 40,000/='.
questions.hint: Look for the currency value in instruction (g).

questions.question: The NSSF field should be added BEFORE the payee field.
questions.explanation: Instruction (d) states: 'Add the field... after the payee'.
questions.hint: Read the positioning instruction in (d) carefully.
